title: Betim

The citations that he has in his descendant's diligence do not show any defamation or information that he was a Jewish person (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 62, 72, 92). people.name: Maria Betim
history: A person that her history modified many times, but never for her attitudes, it was always due to her uncle, André Fernandes (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 5, 28, 33, 47, 94, 110), and her husband's actions during a civil war (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 28). Firstly, it is exposed to the historical events, before using the scientific method to select Maria Betim's origin.

As it was already described in Fernandes' family, during the civil war between Pires and Camargo, the Fernandes fought side to side with Pires' family, but they also had actions against Camargo that created conditions for a poem to be written, this poem was the "proof" used "to do" them a Jewish family (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 48, 94). As Maria Betim is also a Fernandes, she also "became" a Jewish person, as it is written in a diligence for Familiar of the Holy Office:

  • In the diliigencee introduction it is informed (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 5)
    • "Outras intentaram fundar do dito rumo de X.N. movido contra o habilitando dizendo que lhe provinha de por parte de sua avó paterna por ser a mãe desta chamada Maria Betim netta de um Fulano Fernandes natural da villa de Moura"
  • Details about the defamation received were present by all witness (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 24):
    • "Informamos com pessoas antigas fidedignas e Cristãos Velhos sobre a Limpeza de Sangue... E todas as testemunhas q. ... ouvirão dizer aos antigos que Mª Betim tinha Raça de Judeu ... algumas das mesmas disserao q. a mesma fama ou Rumor corria ainda q. mesmo publica dos Avos paternos do habilitando mas não sabe do fundamento"
  • She and her husband baptism her homonymous daughter on 6th of September 1642 (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 25).
  • The Camargo's defamation to Maria, to be descendant of Fernandes' family, appears with the first witness (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 28)
    • "sua mulher Maria Betim no tempo das guerras civis de São Paulo entre os Pires e Camargos o capitão Garcia Roiz Velho favoreceu aos Pires por este ódio os Camargos... como o fez com outras famílias que esta Maria Betim, mulher de Garcia Roiz Velho era cristão novo por parte do avô Fulano Fernandes natural da cidade de Moura"
  • The Priest Fray Francisco de São José describes the war events, adding the name of the person that made defamation (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 45-46):
    • "por ouvir algum rumor de Cristão Novo por p. de sua Avo M.ª Garcia ... ouvira a Fernado de Camargo, homem de má lingoa"
  • When Pedro Dias Paes Leme ascendants are described, it is explicitly said that the "proof" to do the Betim a Jewish family was a poem made for Fernandes' family, her ancestor:
    • "Em ocasião da Satyra do Mullato Luiz Fernandes Levantarão este D. M.ª Betim Bisavó do habilitando era Cristã Nova como descendente dos Fernandes, porém como tudo isto era falso e sem fundamentos..."
    In the diligence there is more data about the family (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 92, 94, 100, 110, 137, 146, 158, 160) and we invite the reader to read it.

It is also necessary to append the following parts before to continue the study:
  • There is a citation that Maria Betim had a son named like his father (História da Família, 2014) that became a Priest (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, 68), independent of the defamation (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, 45);
  • Detailed explanation about defamation linked to Garcia Roiz Paes (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 42, 47), Pedro Dias Paes Leme's father, that is partially described (Bogaciovas, Marcelo M. A, 2015, pp. 279-280) in a document that we have nowadays (Torre do Tombo, Mesa da Consciência e Ordens, Habilitações para a Ordem de Cristo, Letra G, mç. 6, n.º 66);
  • Another Garcia Roiz Paes' son, Ignácio Dias Paes, also became a priest, but he passed away before to be officialized (Torre do Tombo, Mesa da Consciência e Ordens, Habilitações para a Ordem de Cristo, Letra G, mç. 6, n.º 66, img. 7, 39, 42, 43, 44, 50, 51, 88, 121, 231);

The exposed defamation during 18h century were again treated as "prooving" that they were Jewish people:

  • José Gonçalves Salvador cites Priest Garcia Roiz's document (História da Família, 2014) affirming correctly that he is declared "cristão-velho" by his ancestors (Salvador, José G., 1969, pp. 17-18), but he uses a Garcia Roiz Paes' partial documentation (Bogaciovas, Marcelo M. A, 2015, pp. 279-280) to suggest they were Jewish people.
  • When Marcelo M. A. Bogaciovas talks about Maria Betim in his master's degree dissertation, he says that "Entretanto, há dois documentos que tratam as duas Marias Betins como cristãs-novas.". The first document is the cited partial document as he describes in his book (Bogaciovas, Marcelo M. A, 2015, pp. 279-280), information that is not exposed in his dissertation (Bogaciovas, Marcelo M. A, 2006, pp. 95-96), while the second document proves that Maria Betim never paid "fintas" like Jewish people (Bogaciovas, Marcelo M. A, 2006, pp. 96-97). Another complement in the book, it is citation of different diligence of Familiar of Holy Office of his descendants, but he did not give details about them (Bogaciovas, Marcelo M. A, 2015, pp. 282). Finally, it is necessary to call attention that in the dissertation and in the book, it is informed that Geraldo Betim, Maria Betim's father, is "homem muito bem cristão" according to different witness (Bogaciovas, Marcelo M. A, 2015, pp. 279 ; Bogaciovas, Marcelo M. A, 2006, pp. 95-96).

Let us use the scientific method to identify Maria Betim's origin:

  • The scientific method starts with the hypotheses:
    • HYPOTHESIS 1: both José G. Salvador and Marcelo M. A. Bogaciovas use defamation as basis to say that Maria Betim would be a Jewish person, so we consider they have the same hypothesis.
    • HYPOTHESIS 2: Maria Betim is not a Jewish person.
  • After having the hypotheses, it is necessary to look for primary sources that allow to confirm them:
    • HYPOTHESIS 1: it was found a document that says explicitly "... sua avó materna por fama constante, e por estes impedimentos se julgou por incapaz de entrar na Ordem", the cited grandmother is Maria Betim (Torre do Tombo, Mesa da Consciência e Ordens, Habilitações para a Ordem de Cristo, Letra G, mç. 6, n.º 66), but as one of the authors said years later, this is a partial document (Bogaciovas, Marcelo M. A, 2015, pp. 279-280). There is also a second document that proves that Maria Betim never paid "fintas" as Jewish people (Bogaciovas, Marcelo M. A, 2015, pp. 279-280).
    • HYPOTHESIS 2: witness show that the defamation linked to Maria Betim has its origin in actions taken by her husband and her uncle during a civl war (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 5, 28, 33, 47, 94, 110). Her connection with the Christian faith is shown through her homonymous daughter's baptism (Torre do Tombo, Tribunal do Santo Ofício: Conselho Geral, Habilitações, Pedro, mç. 25, doc. 476, img. 25). Recently, a research not finalized is showing that her mitochondrial haplogroup is C1b (subgroup) C1b (subgroup) (de Sillos, Luiz Gustavo, 2023, t. 01:07:10 ; History Tracers (2024): Living Beings), this means that her maternal lineage is indigenous.
  • The THEORY is made using primary sources and comparing them with the hypotheses:
    • A HYPOTHESIS 1 takes as basis a partial document, that does not have foundation to give any final conclusion. The second document used in HYPOTHESIS 1 it is fascinating, because it shows that Maria Betim never paid "fintas", this implies to do the hypothesis weaker. About the HYPOTHESIS 2's prove, Maria Betim's mitochondrial DNA (History Tracers (2024): Living Beings) shows her maternal ancestors were an Indigenous people, so there are no Jewish people in her maternal lineage. We have to look for the parental lineage. As Marcelo M. A. Bogaciovas said, there was no defamation linked to Geraldo Betim, this fact conducts us to her maternal grandfather, Manuel Fernandes Ramos. The Pedro Dias Paes Leme's diligence says that the unique "prove" used to do the Fernandes' family Jewish is a poem made by Luiz Fernandes. Finally, the conclusion that the HYPOTHESIS 1 is false is presented by Marcelo M. A. Bogaciovas in his book, when he writes that Manuel Fernandes Ramos' family is Christian (Bogaciovas, Marcelo M. A, 2015, pp. 268-269). Q.E.D. (Util new documents appear that can change current understanding, because science always advances with data.)
Her generation is described in her husband's family.
